Parashurama.Role: Sixth Avatar of Vishnu, Warrior Sage

ConnectionToEpics.Ramayana: Mentor to warriors, appears during Sita's swayamvara to challenge Rama.
ConnectionToEpics.Mahabharata: Guru to Karna and other warriors; curses Karna for lying about his lineage.

LifeThemes: Destroyer of Kshatriyas who abused power
Teacher of martial arts and astras

MajorStories.Description: Killed Kshatriyas 21 times to restore balance after his father was slain.
Imparted knowledge of astras to Karna, later cursed him for deceit.
Challenged Rama after breaking Shiva’s bow; recognized Rama as Vishnu’s avatar.

CursesGiven.Reason: Lied about being a Brahmin to learn astras.
CursesGiven.Consequence: Would forget Brahmastra mantra at a crucial moment.

Mantras.Name: Parashurama Invocation
Mantras.Meaning: Salutation to Parashurama, the warrior sage.

Timeline.Event: Born to sage Jamadagni and Renuka; blessed with divine strength and an axe from Shiva.
Trained in warfare and Vedic knowledge; deeply devoted to Shiva.
Kshatriya king Kartavirya Arjuna kills Jamadagni; Parashurama vows revenge.
Destroys Kshatriya clans 21 times to avenge his father and restore dharma.
Gives away conquered lands to Brahmins; retreats to penance.
Becomes guru to great warriors including Karna, Bhishma, and Drona.
Challenges Rama after Shiva’s bow is broken; realizes Rama is Vishnu’s avatar and withdraws.
Continues as a sage; immortal and present in many legends.
